publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2890 Elaine Murray: Electric Shock Training - Disappointment at Decision—That the Parliament expresses disappointment at the Scottish Government’s decision not to push ahead with a ban on electric shock training devices until the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs research is completed in 2010; notes that the Welsh Assembly has already announced a ban on their use in Wales and is currently drafting legislation; further notes that a wide range of organisations, including the Kennel Club, veterinary surgeons, respected dog trainers and behaviour experts, call for the sale and use of electric shock collars to be prohibited in Scotland, and urges the Scottish Government to review its decision.

S3M-2890 Electric Shock Training - Disappointment at Decision (lodged on 14 November 2008) Mary Mulligan*, Marlyn Glen*, Jackie Baillie*, Bill Butler*, David Whitton*, David Stewart*, Patricia Ferguson*, Cathie Craigie*, Ross Finnie*, Rhoda Grant*, Karen Whitefield*, Trish Godman*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Peter Peacock*

S3M-2890 Electric Shock Training - Disappointment at Decision (lodged on 14 November 2008) John Park*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Robert Brown*, Ken Macintosh*, Mike Pringle*, James Kelly*, Hugh Henry*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*
S3M-2890 Electric Shock Training - Disappointment at Decision (lodged on 14 November 2008) Irene Oldfather*, Mr Frank McAveety*
S3M-2890 Electric Shock Training - Disappointment at Decision (lodged on 14 November 2008) Robin Harper*
S3M-2890 Electric Shock Training - Disappointment at Decision (lodged on 14 November 2008) Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-2890 Electric Shock Training - Disappointment at Decision (lodged on 14 November 2008) Patrick Harvie*
S3M-2890 Electric Shock Training - Disappointment at Decision (lodged on 14 November 2008) Cathy Peattie* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
